result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane A Taylor

defendant.name: Taylor, Shane A
defendant.address: 100 Corrections Drive, c/o Stanley Correctional Institution, Stanley, WI 54768

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:02 AM Defendant Shane A Taylor appeared by video, in custody at Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Shane A Taylor. Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant will be waiving preliminary hearing.  Defendant consents to the waiver of the preliminary hearing by zoom today.  Atty. Murray completes the preliminary hearing waiver in court today for the defendant. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Murray withdraws prompt disposition request. Bail remains as fixed. Atty. Murray requests a further proceedings date with the possibility of it becoming a plea and sentencing date.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

4:04 PM Defendant Shane A Taylor appeared by zoom video, in custody at Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Shane A Taylor. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marufo.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Defendant to be incarcerated until 2/10/2024.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. Atty. Murray requests a status conference regarding the preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

1:08 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Shane A Taylor appeared by Zoom, in custody at Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Eryn M Menden appeared by Zoom for Shane A Taylor.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Attorney Menden requests to withdraw as counsel due to a scheduling conflict.
The Defendant does not object.
The Court will withdraw attorney Menden. 
New counsel shall be appointed by the SPD.
The Court will adjourn the matter. 
The Court will quash the warrant.
THE COURT WILL ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM STANELY CORRECTIONAL FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
